title: Reply to an existing comment on an owned video

headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Access token authorized by TikTok creators. To obtain an access token, use /tt_user/oauth2/token/ .

headers.name: Content-Type
headers.description: Request message type. Allowed format: application/json .

parameters.name: business_id
parameters.description: Application specific unique identifier for the TikTok account. Pass the value of the open_id field returned in the response of /tt_user/oauth2/token/ to this field.

parameters.name: video_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for owned TikTok video to create the reply on. This can be accessed via the /business/video/list/ endpoint as the item_id for each video listed.

parameters.name: comment_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for comment on an owned TikTok video to create reply on. This can be accessed via the /business/comment/list/ endpoint as the comment_id for each comment listed.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text content of the reply to create. Length limit: 150 characters (UTF-8 encoding). Example : "This is a comment #comment ðŸ™‚".

top_fields.name: Date
top_fields.description: Date and time (GMT) when the response was received. Example : Fri, 13 Aug 2021 08:04:42 GMT

top_fields.name: X-Tt-Logid
top_fields.description: Unique identifier for the API request.

item_fields.name: request_id
item_fields.description: Unique identifier for the API request. Please record this field for all API requests. Important for issue reports and troubleshooting.

item_fields.name: code
item_fields.description: Response code. For the complete list of response codes and descriptions, see Appendix - Return Codes .

item_fields.name: message
item_fields.description: Response message. For details, see Appendix - Return Information .

item_fields.name: comment_id
item_fields.description: Unique identifier for the newly created reply. Example : 6990565363377392901

item_fields.name: parent_comment_id
item_fields.description: Unique identifier for the comment to which the reply was created. Example : 6990565363377392901

item_fields.name: video_id
item_fields.description: Unique identifier for the owned video the reply was created on. Example : 6990565363377392901

item_fields.name: user_id To-be-deprecated
item_fields.description: Developer application and TikTok account scoped unique identifier for the user that made the reply. Example : ce9b7be629b0447af777a0ad945783f61b7f790982b49fbda04a23b4722eaffe Note : This field will be deprecated in the next API version. We recommend using unique_identifier to identify the TikTok user because the identifier remains consistent across different APIs.

item_fields.name: unique_identifier
item_fields.description: A globally unique identifier assigned to each user commenting. This identifier remains consistent across different APIs, facilitating cross-referencing and integration. Example : +ABc1D2/E0fGhijklMNOrD34vDW/zDiZUNRH5Jyahue6OcA7b8ZpwnqXV9u1Uh+k

item_fields.name: create_time
item_fields.description: Unix/Epoch date-time when the reply was created, in UTC timezone. Example : 1627617835

item_fields.name: text
item_fields.description: Text content of the reply. Example : "This is a comment #comment ðŸ™‚"
